summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 among members of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force and a federal prosecutor, discussing logistical coordination for interviews and subpoenas related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It references attempts to interview individuals who worked with Epstein or have information about him, including a publicist named 'S'.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding scheduling a meeting with individuals who worked with Epstein; appears to be part of the investigative team.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding scheduling a meeting with individuals who worked with Epstein; appears to be part of the investigative team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; referenced as having had a conversation with publicist S about his reputation and his prior conduct, specifically commenting that his conviction did not constitute pedophilia.

connections.description: S is described as a publicist who had a recent conversation with Epstein about Epstein's reputation and prior conduct.
Both are addressed together in an email regarding scheduling investigative meetings, indicating they are colleagues on the task force.

events.title: Prosecutor's Request for Interviews
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails the task force to schedule meetings with individuals who previously worked with Epstein and to contact publicist S, potentially with a subpoena.

events.title: Task Force Coordination for Subpoena
events.description: Emails among task force members coordinate assistance for interviewing an individual (name redacted) and serving a subpoena the following day.

events.title: Email Chain Continuation
events.description: The email chain continues with a member offering to assist with the interview/subpoena task if possible.

keyFacts: The NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force was actively coordinating interviews and subpoenas related to the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
Investigators sought to interview individuals who previously worked with Epstein, noting they may have been victims of 'coercive sexual encounters' with Epstein and/or his associates.

Publicist 'S' was a person of interest because he had a recent conversation with Epstein where Epstein discussed his reputation and defended his prior conduct, claiming it did not constitute pedophilia.
The email references that federal prosecutors were 'closing in with new charges' against Epstein around three months prior (approximately April 2019).
Multiple names of individuals to be interviewed are redacted in the document.
